intro: Hesperaster nudus, commonly known as the naked star, is a rare and unusual plant species belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white in color. The plant has a slender, branching stem with few leaves, which are simple and opposite in arrangement. It is native to specific regions of South America, particularly in Brazil, and thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its rarity and unique morphology, Hesperaster nudus is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
